it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core
Class NodeEvent

java.lang.Object
  it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.SimulationObject
      it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.Event
          it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.NodeEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Event>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BirthEvent, DisconnectionEvent, MultipleRandomConnectionsEvent, SingleConnectionEvent
public abstract class NodeEvent
extends Event

Abstract class for all the Events which exist if and only if they are associated with a Node.

The "hasSameAssociatedNode" param must be set to true if we want that each clone has the same associated node of the cloned NodeEvent.

Author:
Matteo Agosti (agosti@ce.unipr.it), Michele Amoretti (michele.amoretti@unipr.it)
See Also:
NodeEvent

Constructor Detail

NodeEvent

public NodeEvent(java.lang.String id,
                 java.util.Properties params,
                 Process parentProcess)
          throws InvalidParamsException
Class constructor that builds the event with its minimal set of properties. Each implementing class should call the super constructor and immediately after invoke the initialize method to check that the event parameters are correct. This class constructor is an example of how it should be implemented, since NodeEvent extends the Event class itself.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the event as specified in the configuration file.
params - the properties that will be handled by the event.
parentProcess - the parent process of the event.
Throws:
InvalidParamsException - if the given parameter are wrong.

Sets whether the node associated to the event will be cloned with the event.

Parameters:
hasSameAssociatedNode - true if the node associated to the event will be cloned with the event as well, false otherwise.

initialize

public void initialize()
                throws InvalidParamsException
The initialization method parse the configuration parameter that sets whether the node associated event should be cloned with the event as well or not.

Specified by:
initialize in class Event
Throws:
InvalidParamsException - if the parameters passed to the event are wrong.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Clone the event and if the property of cloning the associated node is true it will clone it as well otherwise it will set it to null.
